name: Request
comment: Represents an HTTP request to be processed by a Shelf application.

pathInfo.name: pathInfo
pathInfo.comment:
The remainder of the shelf/shelf.Request.requestedUri path designating the virtual "location" of the request's target within the handler.

shelf/shelf.Request.pathInfo may be an empty string, if requestedUri targets the handler root and does not have a trailing slash.

shelf/shelf.Request.pathInfo is never null. If it is not empty, it will start with /.

shelf/shelf.Request.scriptName and shelf/shelf.Request.pathInfo combine to create a valid path that should correspond to the shelf/shelf.Request.requestedUri path.

queryString.name: queryString
queryString.comment: The portion of the request URL that follows the "?", if any.

method.name: method
method.comment: The HTTP request method, such as "GET" or "POST".

scriptName.name: scriptName
scriptName.comment:
The initial portion of the shelf/shelf.Request.requestedUri path that corresponds to the handler.

shelf/shelf.Request.scriptName allows a handler to know its virtual "location".

If the handler corresponds to the "root" of a server, it will be an empty string, otherwise it will start with a /

shelf/shelf.Request.scriptName and shelf/shelf.Request.pathInfo combine to create a valid path that should correspond to the shelf/shelf.Request.requestedUri path.

protocolVersion.name: protocolVersion
protocolVersion.comment: The HTTP protocol version used in the request, either "1.0" or "1.1".

ifModifiedSince.name: ifModifiedSince
ifModifiedSince.comment:
If this is non-null and the requested resource hasn't been modified since this date and time, the server should return a 304 Not Modified response.

This is parsed from the If-Modified-Since header in shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers. If shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers doesn't have an If-Modified-Since header, this will be null.

pathSegments.name: pathSegments
pathSegments.comment: Convenience property to access shelf/shelf.Request.pathInfo data as a dart-core.List.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides shelf/shelf.Request.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

contentLength.name: contentLength
contentLength.comment:
The contents of the content-length field in shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers.

If not set, null.

mimeType.name: mimeType
mimeType.comment:
The MIME type of the message.

This is parsed from the Content-Type header in shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers. It contains only the MIME type, without any Content-Type parameters.

If shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers doesn't have a Content-Type header, this will be null.

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.comment:
The encoding of the message body.

This is parsed from the "charset" paramater of the Content-Type header in shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers.

If shelf/shelf-message.Message.headers doesn't have a Content-Type header or it specifies an encoding that dart:convert doesn't support, this will be null.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and shelf/shelf.Request.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the shelf/shelf.Request.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
shelf/shelf.Request.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to shelf/shelf.Request.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If shelf/shelf.Request.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of shelf/shelf.Request.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

read.name: read
read.comment:
Returns a shelf/dart-async.Stream representing the body.

Can only be called once.

readAsString.name: readAsString
readAsString.comment:
Returns a shelf/dart-async.Future containing the body as a String.

If shelf/shelf.Request.readAsString.encoding is passed, that's used to decode the body. Otherwise the encoding is taken from the Content-Type header. If that doesn't exist or doesn't have a "charset" parameter, UTF-8 is used.

This calls shelf/shelf.Request.read internally, which can only be called once.
